{{cpp/locale/locale/title|name}}
{{cpp/locale/locale/navbar}}

{{ddcl|header=locale|
std::string name() const;
}}

Returns the name of the locale, which is the name by which it is known to the operating system, such as {{c|"POSIX"}} or {{c|"en_US.UTF8"}} or {{c|"English_United States.1252"}}. If the locale is not a copy of a system-supplied locale, the string {{c|"*"}} is returned.

===Return value===
The name of the locale or {{c|"*"}} if unnamed.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;locale&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;

int main()
{
    std::locale loc(std::locale(), new std::ctype&lt;char&gt;);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; "The default locale is " &lt;&lt; std::locale().name() &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "The user's locale is " &lt;&lt; std::locale("").name() &lt;&lt; '\n'
              &lt;&lt; "A nameless locale is " &lt;&lt; loc.name() &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|p=true
|output=
The default locale is C
The user's locale is en_US.UTF8
A nameless locale is *
}}
